title: Ex-Tennessee House Speaker Casada, top aide pardoned by Trump
shortDescription: Days before he was due to report to prison, former Tennessee House Speaker Glen Casada and his top aide reportedly got word they will be pardoned.

title: Former CIA head accused of lying to Congress
shortDescription: Media Miss Minute: Former CIA Director John Brennan accused of lying to Congress; Jon Stewart says Trump is "king adjacent."

title: Gold lettering appears at White House in Trump's latest alteration
shortDescription: New gold-lettered signs were spotted across the White House this week.

title: Trump tries to seize affordability issue back from Democrats
shortDescription: "We are the ones that have done a great job on affordability... but we just lost an election, they said, based on affordability," Trump said Nov. 6.

title: Judge orders Trump administration to fully fund SNAP for November
shortDescription: A federal judge has ordered the government to pay out all the SNAP benefits it normally would this month, despite the ongoing shutdown.

title: Trump on Pelosi retirement: 'She was an evil woman'
shortDescription: Asked about Pelosi, the first woman to serve as speaker of the House, hours after she said she would not run for reelection, Trump said he was glad she was retiring.

title: Trump preps 'game two plan' for SCOTUS case
shortDescription: President Trump said he will develop a "game two plan" to carry out his tariff agenda in case the Supreme Court rules against his tariffs.

title: Trump calls Pelosi ‘evil woman’
shortDescription: President Donald Trump called House Democratic leader Nancy Pelosi an "evil woman" in reaction to her retirement.

title: Trump looks to 'game two plan' if Supreme Court rejects his tariffs
shortDescription: President Trump said he will develop a "game two plan" to carry out his tariff agenda in case the Supreme Court rules against his tariffs.

title: Supreme Court revives Trump's transgender and nonbinary passport policy
shortDescription: The Trump administration does not want to issue passports to transgender and nonbinary Americans that reflect their gender identities.

title: GOP lawmaker accused of 'stalking' Democrats, collecting car info
shortDescription: U.S. Sen. Jacky Rosen of Nevada accused Ohio Sen. Bernie Moreno of invading the privacy of Senate Democrats and their staff.

title: Nancy Pelosi retires from Congress. Who could take her seat?
shortDescription: Two known Democratic figures have already thrown their hats in the ring for Pelosi's 11th Congressional District.

title: Trump announces weight-loss drugs cost cuts
shortDescription: President Donald Trump announces discounted pricing for Zepbound and Wegovy and expanding Medicare coverage so more people can access the drugs.

title: White House pauses event after attendee faints
shortDescription: The White House said the man fainted and is ok. He collapsed as speakers were discussing the deal to reduce the cost of weight loss drugs.

title: Chicago judge rules against Trump over immigration agents’ tactics
shortDescription: U.S. District Judge Sara L. Ellis’ ruling is aimed at protecting the free speech rights of journalists, clergy and protesters in Chicago.

title: Trump announces lower prices, Medicare coverage for weight-loss drugs
shortDescription: The deal is with drugmakers Eli Lilly and Novo Nordisk to cut prices of their weight-loss drugs and expand Medicare coverage of these medications.

title: Trump gets new review of New York criminal hush money case
shortDescription: President Trump has argued that presidents are immune from prosecution over their official acts.

title: Trump then & now: What did the president say in the 2019 shutdown?
shortDescription: The government shutdown has officially become the longest shutdown in American history. President Donald Trump was in office for the previous record.
